Cihuatlán is located on the coast of Jalisco, Mexico. The toponym Cihuatlán, from the Náhuatl Cihua (woman) and tlán (place), and the report no doubt reminded Cortés of the Island of the Amazons from Las sergas de Esplandián.

Eventually Cortés’ wife, doña Juana de Zúñiga, fearing her husband dead, sent out a rescue party in the form of a caravel. The caravel, sent from the mainland, carried a letter from the recently arrived first Viceroy of New Spain, don Antonio de Mendoza, urging the party’s immediate return. Cortés arrived at the mainland from the failed voyage, starved and without riches, rescued by his wife and scolded by the Viceroy.
